citations.narrative:
A developed and written contingency plan was not available at the time of inspection. A complete written contingency plan
helps facilities prepare and plan for the humane care and handling of animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
Correct by January 17, 2025 by developing and maintaining a written emergency plan that is tailored to the facility and
provides for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of animals on hand in the event of an
emergency or disaster. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this plan. The plan must
also be reviewed annually, and any changes documented and maintained.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility is currently exhibiting 12 domestic chickens and 2 domestic geese but does not have an environmental
enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of birds. A multifaceted enhancement plan for birds is instrumental
for their well-being as a means to address their needs to express species-typical behavior and promote overall
psychological well-being. Environmental enhancement plans must address all species needs specific to social grouping,
environmental enrichment, and special considerations (i.e. housing nestlings, chicks or fledglings; birds showing signs of
psychological distress through behavior or appearance; birds requiring restricted activity; and individually housed birds
unable to see and hear birds of their own or compatible species).
Correct by January 17, 2025 by developing an environmental enhancement plan for birds as directed by the attending
veterinarian and in accordance with currently accepted professional standards.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
A developed and written contingency plan was not available at the time of inspection. A complete written contingency plan 
helps facilities prepare and plan for the humane care and handling of animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.  
 
Correct by January 17, 2025 by developing and maintaining a written emergency plan that is tailored to the facility and 
provides for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of animals on hand in the event of an 
emergency or disaster. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this plan. The plan must 
also be reviewed annually, and any changes documented and maintained. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility is currently exhibiting 12 domestic chickens and 2 domestic geese but does not have an environmental 
enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of birds. A multifaceted enhancement plan for birds is instrumental 
for their well-being as a means to address their needs to express species-typical behavior and promote overall 
psychological well-being. Environmental enhancement plans must address all species needs specific to social grouping, 
environmental enrichment, and special considerations (i.e. housing nestlings, chicks or fledglings; birds showing signs of 
psychological distress through behavior or appearance; birds requiring restricted activity; and individually housed birds 
unable to see and hear birds of their own or compatible species).  
 
Correct by January 17, 2025 by developing an environmental enhancement plan for birds as directed by the attending 
veterinarian and in accordance with currently accepted professional standards. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
